submission:
class Solution:
    def minFlips(self, grid: List[List[int]]) -> int:
        m, n = len(grid), len(grid[0])
        left, right, down, up = 0, n - 1, 0, m - 1
        ans = 0
        while left < right:
            down, up = 0, m - 1
            while down < up:
                num = 0
                for j, i in [(left, down), (left, up), (right, down), (right, up)]:
                    num += grid[i][j]
                ans += min(num, 4 - num)
                down += 1
                up -= 1
            left += 1
            right -= 1
            
        if left == right and down == up:
            down, up = 0, m - 1
            num = 0
            num1 = 0
            while down < up:
                num += (grid[down][left] != grid[up][left])
                num1 += grid[down][left]
                down += 1
                up -= 1
            left, right = 0, n - 1
            while left < right:
                num += (grid[down][left] != grid[up][right])
                num1 += grid[down][left]
                left += 1
                right -= 1
            ans += num + (2 * (num == 0 and num1 & 1 == 1))
        
        elif left == right:
            down, up = 0, m - 1
            num = 0
            num1 = 0
            while down < up:
                num += (grid[down][left] != grid[up][left])
                num1 += grid[down][left]
                down += 1
                up -= 1
            ans += num + (2 * (num == 0 and num1 & 1 == 1))
        
        elif down == up:
            left, right = 0, n - 1
            num = 0
            num1 = 0
            while left < right:
                num += (grid[down][left] != grid[up][right])
                num1 += grid[down][left]
                left += 1
                right -= 1
            ans += num + (2 * (num == 0 and num1 & 1 == 1))
        
        return (ans + (down == up and left == right and grid[up][right]))
